items.sentence: I have some business to do in the Boston office.
Tom said he wasn\'t sure what Mary wanted to do.
Tom said he wouldn\'t do what I asked him to do.
Tom said he\'d be happy to answer our questions.
Tom said he\'d prefer that you not do that here.
We hope Tom will do what we\'ve asked him to do.
Tom said he\'d be willing to do anything for me.
Tom says he doesn\'t know anything about Boston.
Tom and Mary contradict each other all the time.
You seem to know a lot about Tom and his family.
You should always wash your hands before eating.
Her voice could hardly be heard above the noise.
She got a slight burn on her hand while cooking.
Nobody noticed the picture was hung upside down.
I\'m certain that Tom will pass the examination.
I\'m glad that I was able to meet you yesterday.
I\'m going to Boston for a few days on business.
Tom and Mary don\'t like the same kind of music.
I was as surprised by Tom\'s arrest as you were.
I\'d like to spend a few moments with Tom alone.
